rights.description: Constitutional foundation provides fundamental right of access - 'people's right to know is key to all their liberties'
rights.implementation_notes: UNIQUE: Constitutional protection at highest level of state law
rights.request_tips: Cite constitutional right of access when challenging denials - this is fundamental right

rights.description: Record must be produced for inspection within 3 business days of receipt, or certification made that record is exempt within 3 business days
rights.implementation_notes: One of the fastest response times in the nation - no extension mechanism
rights.request_tips: Agency must respond within 3 business days - no exceptions or extensions allowed

rights.description: Staff time charges allowed only if request exceeds 30 minutes; charges must be reasonable and actual costs only
rights.conditions: 30 minute threshold before search fees apply
rights.implementation_notes: Protects against excessive search fees for routine requests
rights.request_tips: If charged search fees, verify request took over 30 minutes; demand documentation of time spent

rights.description: Court costs and attorney's fees may be awarded; damages available for willful and knowing violations
rights.conditions: Must prevail in court action; willful violations for damages
rights.implementation_notes: Damages for willful violations create strong deterrent
rights.request_tips: If wrongfully denied, attorney fees and damages recoverable if violation was willful and knowing

rights.description: Criminal penalties apply for willful and knowing violations
rights.conditions: Violation must be willful and knowing
rights.applies_to: Public officials who willfully violate PRA
rights.implementation_notes: Strongest possible penalty - creates powerful deterrent
rights.request_tips: If denial appears intentional and willful, criminal penalties may apply

rights.description: No identification or purpose statement required; may be oral or written (written preferred)
rights.implementation_notes: Oral requests accepted but written preferred for documentation
rights.request_tips: You do not need to identify yourself or state your purpose

rights.description: Provisions shall be liberally construed to implement policy of access; exemptions construed narrowly
rights.implementation_notes: Creates strong presumption in favor of disclosure
rights.request_tips: Cite liberal construction mandate when challenging restrictive interpretations

rights.description: Burden of proof on public agency to sustain denial
rights.implementation_notes: Requester does not need to prove entitlement - agency must justify denial
rights.request_tips: If denied, agency bears burden to prove exemption applies

rights.description: Must justify denials with specific exemption citations
rights.request_tips: If denied, demand specific statutory citation for exemption claimed

rights.description: State agencies: 9 AM-12 PM and 1 PM-4 PM except weekends/holidays; Political subdivisions: customary business hours
rights.request_tips: For state agencies, inspection guaranteed during core business hours (9-12 and 1-4)

rights.description: Standard formats available: photocopies or electronic format
rights.request_tips: Request electronic format when available to reduce copying fees

rights.statute_citation: Vermont Constitution Chapter I, Article 6; 1 V.S.A. § 315
rights.description: Strong presumption of access - people's right to know is fundamental to self-governance
rights.implementation_notes: Constitutional and statutory presumption in favor of openness
rights.request_tips: Cite presumption of access and constitutional foundation when challenging denials

validation_metadata.primary_statute: 1 V.S.A. §§ 315-320; Vermont Constitution Chapter I, Article 6
validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. Vermont has exceptionally strong requester protections including: (1) constitutional right of access (unique), (2) 3 business day response deadline (very fast), (3) 30-minute threshold before search fees apply, (4) damages and criminal penalties for willful violations, (5) liberal construction mandate, and (6) burden of proof on agency.
